name: naive-definitions-vscode
description: A naive, regex find-in-files implementation of going to the definition of a symbol

items.title: Definition keyword/prefix or a regex to which the selected text will be added or, if using the ${SELECTED_TEXT} token, replaced. If a regex is used, it is this definition's that will be used instead of the general matcher. To signal a regex, the definition must start with ${regex}=

naive-definitions-vscode.definitions.description: Various (preferably somewhat unique) keywords/prefixes or regexes to which the selected text will be added or, if using the ${SELECTED_TEXT} token, replaced. If a regex is used, it is the definition's that will be used instead of the general matcher. To signal a regex, the definition must start with ${regex}=. These should be specified in the order of precedence!

naive-definitions-vscode.fileTypes.description: A glob for file matching (example: **/*.{h,cpp} for matching all .h and .cpp files in the workspace).

naive-definitions-vscode.generalMatcher.description: The expression to be used to match a selected text to a potential definition. ${DEFINITION} and ${SELECTED_TEXT} are tokens that will be replaced at runtime with the respective values. Can be empty if you want to use individual regexes for each expression.

scripts.pretest: npm run compile && npm run lint
